name: Express Next Day Delivery Postage
description:
Want to ensure your order arrives by Christmas Eve?

Than add express next day delivery to your order.

All parcels received before midnight on Sunday 22nd December will be posted first thing on Monday morning on an express Next Day Guaranteed service so you can be sure it will be there for you on Christmas Eve.

Applies to UK order only.

name: "Where there's a Weir there's a Way" Print
description: A bright colourful print in tribute to the legendary Scottish climber, author and broadcaster Tom Weir who sadly passed away in 2006. Tom is probably most famous for his long running STV show Weir's Way in which he wandered the hills, villages and glens of Scotland meeting its people, exploring its landscape and passing on interesting facts about its history in his soft gentile way. A group was formed to build a statue of Tom at Loch Lomond to celebrate with great Scot. Wanting to try and help we created this Tshirt of Tom's smiling face adorned by his trademark red bobbled hat with white pompom. £6.50 will be donated to the memorial campaign for every print sold. For more information on the group and how to get involved then please visit their Facebook page here This colourful print would make a great gift for someone with a love of Scottish humour, Tom or the great Scottish outdoors. It also makes a perfect present for expat friends who are missing a bit of Scottish Culture. Unframed digital archival art print on Somerset Velvet 330gsm paper. This is an extremely high quality art print produced at the Glasgow Print Studio. Dimensions:25cm x 20cm

name: "Where there's a Weir there's a Way" Tshirt
description: This tshirt is a tribute to the legendary Scottish climber, author and broadcaster Tom Weir who sadly passed away in 2006. Tom is probably most famous for his long running STV show Weir's Way in which he wandered the hills, villages and glens of Scotland meeting its people, exploring its landscape and passing on interesting facts about its history in his soft gentile way. A group was formed to build a statue of Tom at Loch Lomond to celebrate with great Scot. Wanting to try and help we created this Tshirt of Tom's smiling face adorned by his trademark red bobbled hat with white pompom. £6 will be donated to the memorial campaign for every Tshirt sold. For more information on the group and how to get involved then please visit their Facebook page here Each T-shirt is hand screen printed in crisp white on a high quality Light red Cotton T-shirt. 160-165g/m²100% cotton short sleeved crew neck T-Shirt Twin needle stitching detail on neck, sleeves and hem Cotton/Lycra® rib crew neck with taped neckline for added comfort (Available in small, medium, large, extra large) Sizing Information; Small - 45.7cm front chest, length 68.5cm Medium - 50.8cm front chest, length 71.1cm Large - 55.88cm front chest , length 73.60cm X-Large - 60.96cm front chest , length 76.2cm All lengths are shoulder to hem. All chest measurements are front chest (seam to seam) - Please double for full chest measurement. The EAT HAGGIS AND CEILIDH ON slogan is a trademark of Allistair J Burt. All rights Reserved

name: "Whisky Galore" Print
description:
The perfect gift for anyone who loves whisky or the classic 1947 novel by Compton MacKenzie on which the famous Ealing comedy film is based.

The tale tells how a group of Scottish islanders raid a shipwreck for its consignment of whisky and then attempt to keep them hidden from the prying eyes of the British Authorities.

Unframed digital archival art print on Somerset Velvet 330gsm paper. This is an extremely high quality art print produced at the Glasgow Print Studio.

Dimensions:25cm x 20cm

name: "A dram before the storm" Print
description:
A wonderful gift for a whisky lover.

The sky may be darkening and the storm clouds may be gathering but with a large dram of whisky in your hand there is nothing you can't face.

This design is a tribute to one of Scotlands greatest exports, whisky. Around the circle are the names of the five regions where it is made and the various types that are produced. The date in the centre refers to the first written mention of whisky which was in the Exchequer Rolls of Scotland in 1495.

Unframed digital archival art print on Somerset Velvet 330gsm paper. This is an extremely high quality art print produced at the Glasgow Print Studio.

Dimensions:25cm x 20cm

name: 'Eat Haggis and Ceilidh On' Tea Towel
description:
A natural colour tea towel with our 'Eat Haggis' slogan in a soft red.

The text celebrates two of Scotland's most famous traditions, haggis and ceilidhs. The lion represents the Lion Rampant of Scotland, the Scottish banner historically used by the King of Scots.

This 100% fair trade cotton tea towel has been carefully made in the UK and hand screen printed in Glasgow.

Tea Towel measures 78 x 51 cm.

This is a thick high quality apron with neck hoop and canvas tie backs for securing in place. The aprons are all hand stitched, made in the UK and hand screen printed in Glasgow.

The apron measures approximately 90cm in length and 60cm with 60cm tie backs. 10oz Cotton half panama apron

description:
"There's been a murder" is a well known quote from 'Taggart', the much loved and longest running police drama in the UK. It's usually pronounced with a surfeit of 'Rs.

Each T-shirt is hand screen printed in orange on a high quality Light Graphite Cotton T-shirt.

160-165g/m²100% cotton short sleeved crew neck T-Shirt Twin needle stitching detail on neck, sleeves and hem Cotton/Lycra® rib crew neck with taped neckline for added comfort

name: 'There's Been a Murder' Print
description:
A bright colourful print based on Scottish Fictional Characters

This design is from our 'Scottish Fictional Characters' range celebrating much loved Scottish characters and their humourous catch phrases.

This colourful print would make a great gift for someone with a love of Scottish humour.. It also makes a perfect present for expat friends who are missing a bit of Scottish Culture.

Other Designs in this range: Fan Dabi Dozi and There's Been a Murder'

The print works as an individual piece of artwork or as a set of three

Unframed digital archival art print on Somerset Velvet 330gsm paper. This is an extremely high quality art print produced at the Glasgow Print Studio.

Dimensions:25cm x 20cm

name: Eat Haggis and Ceilidh On
description:
From a series of prints taking a Scottish spin on the classic WWII "Keep Calm and Carry On" posters. 

The text celebrates two of Scotland's most famous traditions, haggis and ceilidhs overlaid on the blue and white cross of the Saltire (the national flag of Scotland.) The lion represents the Lion Rampant of Scotland, the Scottish banner historically used by the King of Scots.
[Large print in limited signed edition of 200] 

Unframed (30cm x 40cm or 18cm x 24cm) digital archival art print on Somerset Velvet 330gsm paper. This is an extremely high quality art print produced at the Glasgow Print Studio.

Prints are securely packaged, wrapped in tissue paper and rolled in postal tubes for posting.

The EAT HAGGIS AND CEILIDH ON slogan is a trademark of Allistair J Burt. All rights Reserved

name: "Twas Christmas told the merriest tale" Card
description: A line from a Sir Walter Scott poem about Christmas. You can read the rest of the poem here The perfect card for anyone with a connection to Scotland. This is a thick 16pt, FSC credited paper stock. With a light satin coating on the outside, the inside is left uncoated, making it easier for you to write your own message. Each card is individually scored, ensuring a clean fold and comes with a simple 100% recycled brown envelope.

description:
A friendly Christmas greeting card with a Scottish twist.

The perfect card for anyone with a connection to Scotland this winter.

This is a thick 16pt, FSC credited paper stock. With a light satin coating on the outside, the inside is left uncoated, making it easier for you to write your own message. Each card is individually scored, ensuring a clean fold and comes with a simple 100% recycled brown envelope.

name: Eat Haggis and Ceilidh On (Apron - Navy)
description:
A thick navy 10oz cotton half panama apron in navy with our 'Eat Haggis' slogan in crisp white. (also available in red) The aprons are all hand stitched and made in the UK.

The text celebrates two of Scotland's most famous traditions, haggis and ceilidhs overlaid on the blue and white cross of the Saltire (the national flag of Scotland.) The lion represents the Lion Rampant of Scotland, the Scottish banner historically used by the King of Scots.

Approx 90cm x 60cm with 60cm long ties at the rear.

name: Great Chieftain o' the Puddin' Race (Apron)
description:
A thick navy 10oz cotton half panama apron in bottle green with a line from Robert Burn's famous poem 'Address to a Haggis' in crisp white print. 

The aprons are all hand stitched, made in the UK and hand screen printed in Glasgow.

Burn's poem, is traditionally read at the start of a Burns supper before the host cuts the haggis with a dagger.

The Poem starts:

Fair fa' your honest, sonsie face, 
Great chieftain o' the puddin' race! 
Aboon them a' yet tak your place, 

The lion on the print represents the Lion Rampant of Scotland, the Scottish banner historically used by the King of Scots.

Approx 90cm x 60cm with 60cm long ties at the rear.

name: Eat Haggis Tote Bag
description:
A strong cotton tote bag, perfect for "going for the messages" which is a classic Scottish term that means going to get the shopping. The origin of "going for the messages" is lost to time but is such a common phrase in Scotland that we don't even realise that its unique to us or that it might cause confusion when used to with people not in the know. Every child growing up in Scotland will at some point or other have been sent to the shops by their mums to "get the messages".

Anyway this 100% cotton long handled bag is perfect for a nice big selection of shopping/ messages.

The EAT HAGGIS AND CEILIDH ON slogan is a trademark of Allistair J Burt. All rights Reserved

description:
An ideal card for New Year, or for parting friends at any time of the year.

From a series of prints taking a Scottish spin on the classic WWII "Keep Calm and Carry On" posters. This is a dark blue tartan print with a line of Burn's poetry which is traditionally sung in the tune Auld Lang Sang on New Year's Eve/ Christmas in Scotland and at the end of weddings.

This is a thick 16pt, FSC credited paper stock. With a light satin coating on the outside, the inside is left uncoated, making it easier for you to write your own message. Each card is individually scored, ensuring a clean fold and comes with a simple 100% recycled brown envelope.

name: Eat Haggis Red apron and blue mug set
description:
The perfect gift set a bright Eat Haggis Red apron and blue mug set.

APRON
A thick 10oz cotton half panama apron in red with our 'Eat Haggis' slogan in crisp white. The aprons are all hand stitched and made in the UK.

The text celebrates two of Scotland's most famous traditions, haggis and ceilidhs. The lion represents the Lion Rampant of Scotland, the Scottish banner historically used by the King of Scots.

Approx 90cm x 60cm with 60cm long ties at the rear.

MUG
A brilliantly printed porcelain mug printed in a medium blue tone with the Eat Haggis slogan in white. (Mugs are microwave and dishwasher safe.)

The EAT HAGGIS AND CEILIDH ON slogan is a trademark of Allistair J Burt. All rights Reserved

name: Eat Haggis and Ceilidh On (wee edition)
description:
From a series of prints taking a Scottish spin on the classic WWII "Keep Calm and Carry On" posters. 

The text celebrates two of Scotland's most famous traditions, haggis and ceilidhs overlaid on the blue and white cross of the Saltire (the national flag of Scotland.) The lion represents the Lion Rampant of Scotland, the Scottish banner historically used by the King of Scots.

Unframed (18cm x 24cm) digital archival art print on Somerset Velvet 330gsm paper. This is an extremely high quality art print produced at the Glasgow Print Studio.

Prints are securely packaged, wrapped in tissue paper and posted flat in a large hard backed envelope.

The EAT HAGGIS AND CEILIDH ON slogan is a trademark of Allistair J Burt. All rights Reserved

name: When will we see your likes again (wee edition)
description:
A line from the unofficial national Scottish anthem printed on a deep golden and red print which reflects the Lion Rampant of Scotland, a flag historically used by the King of Scots and displayed when the national football team plays.

Unframed (18cm x 24cm) digital archival art print on Somerset Velvet 330gsm paper. This is a high quality art print produced at the Glasgow Print Studio.

Prints are securely packaged, wrapped in tissue paper and posted flat in a hard back envelope.

[Large print in limited signed edition of 200] 

Unframed (18cm x 24cm)  digital archival art print on Somerset Velvet 330gsm paper. This is an extremely high quality art print produced at the Glasgow Print Studio.

Prints are securely packaged, wrapped in tissue paper and posted flat in a hard backed envelope.

155g/m 100% cotton pre-shrunk with a seamless collar, taped neck and shoulders.

(Available in small, medium,  large and X-Large)

name: Set of five greetings Cards
description:
Set of five greeting cards, blank inside for your own message. [148 x 105mm] 

The five cards are: 

Eat Haggis and Ceilidh On 
When will we see you likes again 
In my Defens God me defend 
O'Cruel is the snow that sweeps Glencoe 
Wee cowerin Timerous Beastie 

This is a thick 16pt, FSC credited paper stock. With a light satin coating on the outside, the inside is left uncoated, making it easier for you to write your own message. Each card is individually scored, ensuring a clean fold and comes with a simple 100% recycled brown envelope.

name: Personalised Scottish print
description: Have a print designed as a unique one off piece with your own tartan or colour as a background and with a family motto or favourite Scottish phrase printed on top. Produced by the print experts at the Glasgow Print Studio this is a high quality art print that makes an excellent gift to commemorate a special event ie major birthday, house warming, christening or wedding. [The examples on the left are based on customers' family tartans, their mottos or lines from their favourite Scottish novels.] ........................................................................................................... HOW IT WORKS Once you have placed your order we will send you a quick email asking you to confirm the design details. We will work with you to confirm which tartan and phrase/ text you wish to use. As a guide, ideally this should be around five to six words in length though shorter or longer can work too. A few days after you have confirmed all these details we will email you a up a mocked jpeg version of your print for approval. If there are any changes required then you will let us know and we will be happy to tweek and adjust the image. Once you have confirmed approval we will arrange for the print to be created at the Glasgow Print Studio. This can take up to 16 days. Your print will then be parcelled up and posted to you, ready for you to mount, frame and hang on your wall. OPTIONS If you would require something a bit more unusual, ie a tartan we don't currently stock or a different header image then please choose that as an option when placing your order and confirm this to us. There is an additional charge for arranging these as there is more time involved in creating the additional image and we will need to source a section of your chosen tartan from our supplier. SPECIFICATION An unframed and unmounted (30cm x 40cm) digital archival art print on Somerset Velvet 330gsm paper. This is an extremely high quality art print produced at the Glasgow Print Studio. POSTING Prints are securely packaged, wrapped in tissue paper and rolled in protective tubes for posting. EXTRAS Where any special design requirements are needed there may be additional cost. Examples of such work might be tracking down a good sample of an unusual tartan or any additional graphic requests. If it seems additional costs will be required to create your artwork then we will agree these with you before progressing. FREE SHIPPING WITHIN THE UK ........................................................................................................... The EAT HAGGIS AND CEILIDH ON slogan is a trademark of Allistair J Burt. All rights Reserved

name: Personalised Wedding print
description: Have a print designed as a unique one off piece for your or a loved ones wedding day with your choice of tartan or colour background and with a phrase from a traditional Scottish blessing or a poem in crisp white. At the bottom of the print is room to put the happy couple's names and the date of the wedding. Produced by the print experts at the Glasgow Print Studio this is a high quality art print that makes an excellent gift and commemorative keepsake of a special wedding day. [There are some examples in the thumbnails on the left.] ............................................................................................................... HOW IT WORKS Once you have placed your order we will send you a quick email asking you to confirm the design details. We will work with you to confirm the tartan/ background colour and the message you wish to use. As a guide, ideally this should be around five to six words in length though shorter or longer can work too. We have a selection of five different poems/ blessings we can recommend. A few days after you have confirmed all these details we will email you a up a mocked jpeg version of your print for approval. If there are any changes required then you will let us know and we will be happy to tweek and adjust the image. Once you have confirmed approval we will arrange for the print to be created at the Glasgow Print Studio. This can take up to 16 days. Your print will then be parcelled up and posted to you, ready for you to mount, frame and hang on your wall. OPTIONS If you would require something a bit more unusual, ie a tartan we don't currently stock or a different header image then please choose that as an option when placing your order and confirm this to us. There is an additional charge for arranging these as there is more time involved in creating the additional image and we will need to source a section of your chosen tartan from our supplier. SPECIFICATION An unframed and unmounted (30cm x 40cm) digital archival art print on Somerset Velvet 330gsm paper. This is an extremely high quality art print produced at the Glasgow Print Studio. POSTING Prints are securely packaged, wrapped in tissue paper and rolled in protective tubes for posting. EXTRAS Where any special design requirements are needed there may be additional cost. Examples of such work might be tracking down a good sample of an unusual tartan or any additional graphic requests. If it seems additional costs will be required to create your artwork then we will agree these with you before progressing. FREE SHIPPING WITHIN THE UK ............................................................................................................... The EAT HAGGIS AND CEILIDH ON slogan is a trademark of Allistair J Burt. All rights Reserved

name: Event Stationery Design
description:
A bespoke design service for all your event needs - from weddings to birthdays. Prices start from £150.

We can design unique invitations, seating plans, name cards and thank you cards for your special day.

Contact us at info@eathaggis.com to discuss.
